DOC.brief_summary: Regional anesthesia ( spinal , epidural ) consider method choice anesthesia obstetric delivery ability use few drug , direct experience childbirth capability provide excellent postoperative analgesia . However , incidence hypotension spinal anesthesia cesarean delivery high lead maternal fetal morbidity . Certain intervention may reduce incidence severity spinal anesthesia induced hypotension , include use vasopressor intravenous pre- co-hydration use different type volume expanders ; crystalloid colloid solution . Such intervention aim increase maternal cardiac output , key attenuate hypotensive response spinal anesthesia . The primary purpose study compare efficacy intravenous prehydration ( preloading ) healthy parturients schedule caesarean section either crystalloid ( Ringer 's lactate ) colloid solution ( HES 130/0.42 ) prevention hypotension spinal anesthesia . The FloTrac/VigileoTM device provide continuous monitor maternal cardiac output employment minimally invasive technique base arterial pulse contour analysis . Assessment maternal hemodynamic status use FloTrac/VigileoTM constitutes secondary outcome . Other secondary outcome total amount vasopressor use , neonatal outcome , intraoperative side effect maternal satisfaction score .
DOC.brief_title: The Effect Intravenous Prehydration Hemodynamic Status Healthy Parturients Undergoing Spinal Anesthesia Cesarean Delivery
DOC.criteria: American Society Anesthesiologists ( ASA ) I II parturients singleton gestation term gestation ( gestational period 37 week ) extreme weight ( < 50 Kgr > 120 Kgr ) extremes height ( < 150 cm > 180 cm ) baseline heart rate le 65 bpm active labor know fetal abnormality placental abruption , placenta previa/accreta pregnancy induce hypertension anemia ( hemoglobin < 9 gr/dl ) cardiac , respiratory renal disease diabetes mellitus spinal cord abnormalities previous spinal surgery preexist neurological dysfunction know allergy protocol medication absolute contraindication regional anesthesia
